purpose: Introduce basic concepts of fraud management
title: Fraud Management Basics

bullets.text: The unauthorized use of card information or identity credentials to complete unauthorized transactions or maintenance on a card account
The cardholder does not benefit from the unauthorized transaction
Data and analytics are the foundation of effective fraud management
Both Gross and Net losses are measured in dollars, transaction count, number of impacted card accounts, and basis points (bps)
Total Fraud / Total Cleared Authorizations X 10,000 = BPS
Fraud management no longer means stopping fraud. It is proactively managing, monitoring and balancing fraud loss with revenue, profitability, operating expense and customer satisfaction

reasoning_strategy: Emphasize proactive and analytical approaches to fraud management
design_language: Professional with emphasis on key terms
